intro: Ebermaiera gracilis, commonly known as the slender ebermaiera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, palmate leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to white, with five petals and numerous stamens. Ebermaiera gracilis is often found in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests.
